Description: Stone lid made of limestone in a flat and circular shape. The upper side is slightly larger than the underside, with a recess with rounded edges. Parts chipped of at the edge of the top part. On the upper side drawing of a lotus-flower in black ink, only faint traces are still vissible. Well-smoothed on upper and lower surfaces. Both surfaces show black accretion.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 201)
